item.title: Boris Johnson: I've seen no evidence of plotters being blackmailed
item.description: The PM rejects the claims of a Tory MP, who says rebels face intimidation from ministers.

item.title: Bankers told to come back to desks as restrictions end
item.description: Standard Chartered and HSBC ask staff to come back as business groups welcome end of home working.

item.title: Former Pope Benedict failed to act over abuse, new report finds
item.description: Benedict XVI is incriminated in a report into child sex abuse in Munich in the 70s and 80s.

item.title: Teenage pilot Zara Rutherford completes solo round-world record
item.description: Zara Rutherford endured extreme conditions during a trip that took two months longer than planned.

item.title: Australian Open 2022: Emma Raducanu beaten in three sets by Danka Kovinic
item.description: Emma Raducanu says she was warned by her team not to play in the Australian Open second round because of a blister that hampered her in the defeat by Danka Kovinic.

item.title: Tommy Robinson pursued by creditors for an estimated Â£2m
item.description: People owed money by the English Defence League founder have appointed an independent insolvency expert.

item.title: Ukraine tension: Biden says he thinks Putin will 'move in'
item.description: The US president warns the Russian leader against invading, but hints at splits among Western allies.

item.title: Texas synagogue: Brother urged hostage-taker to surrender
item.description: Two men are arrested in Birmingham and Manchester as part of the investigation into the attack.

item.title: Freda and Ken Walker: Murder arrest after couple in 80s attacked at home
item.description: A man is held on suspicion of murdering Freda Walker, 86, and attempting to murder her husband Ken.

item.title: Tonga: First foreign aid planes arrive bearing crucial supplies
item.description: It comes after the Pacific nation was left devastated by a volcanic eruption and subsequent tsunami.

item.title: Dozens of blocks still have Grenfell-type cladding
item.description: The flammable panels have been blamed for the rapid spread of the 2017 fire, which led to 72 deaths.

item.title: Criminal prosecution delays hit record 708 days
item.description: Figures show the average time to deal with a crime rose by 15%, adding to a massive backlog.

item.title: South Georgia: The museum at the end of the world reopens for business
item.description: On a British island at the edge of the Antarctic is one of the most remote tourist spots in the world.

item.title: NHS dentists: Patient forced to turn to DIY dentistry over waiting times
item.description: Patient Sharon Grey turned to DIY dentistry after waiting for treatment for more than a year.

item.title: We are praying for heavy rain - Tonga resident
item.description: Speaking from Tonga's capital, Nuku'alofa, Marian Kupu gives a firsthand account of the moment the undersea volcano erupted.

item.title: Dog rescue: Reggie saved after falling down 10ft crevice
item.description: Reggie "came out a new dog" after the 34-hour mountain rescue.

item.title: After Life 3: How TikTok took a Ricky Gervais fan to Netflix
item.description: Cole Anderson-James was cast by his comedy hero after impersonating him on social media.

item.title: A whirlwind dash through Biden's first year in office
item.description: How did the US president do in his first 12 months in the White House?

item.title: Giant pristine coral reef discovered off Tahiti
item.description: Marine explorers find a "pristine" 3km coral reef at depths of 30m off the coast of Tahiti.

item.title: What high inflation means - in 90 seconds
item.description: The BBC's consumer affairs correspondent, Colletta Smith, breaks it down.

item.title: Covid: Did Pfizer's boss cast doubt on his own vaccine?
item.description: Inaccurate posts about the Pfizer vaccine's protection against Omicron took the drug company's boss out of context.

item.title: Joe Biden one year on: Has the United States become ungovernable?
item.description: A president who promised to unite the country is unable to bring his own party together.

item.title: Tonga: Zero-Covid island nation fears aid could bring in virus
item.description: Efforts are being made to deliver humanitarian supplies with minimum risk of infection.

item.title: Christian Wakeford's long walk to defection
item.description: The MP's journey from the Tories to Labour follows ideological doubts and a lengthy wooing process.

item.title: S Africa scientists: Racism at root of Omicron scepticism
item.description: South African scientists say their research was not taken more seriously because it was from Africa.

item.title: Apple AirTags - 'A perfect tool for stalking'
item.description: Appleâs AirTags are great for finding lost items. But they have a darker side.

item.title: The battle for Steaua Bucharest - an Eastern European giant at war with itself
item.description: European Cup winners in 1986, Steaua Bucharest's story of decline is unlike any other. A bitter dispute has split the club in two.

item.title: Working-from-home guidance shift 'may not save my shop'
item.description: End of work-from-home guidance a boost for hospitality, while nightclubs welcome scrapping of Covid passes.

item.title: Brilliant McGrath helps Australia thrash England in Ashes opener
item.description: England are thrashed in the opening match of the Women's Ashes as Tahlia McGrath fires Australia to a nine-wicket win in the first T20.

item.title: Subdued Murray 'frustrated' and 'disappointed' by Australian Open defeat
item.description: Britain's former world number one Andy Murray produces a subdued display as he loses to Japan's Taro Daniel in the Australian Open second round.

item.title: More County Championship games to be played in June & July as fixtures revealed
item.description: More County Championship matches will be played in June and July following calls for more red-ball cricket in mid-summer.

item.title: Douglas makes Team GB history as first female summer and winter Olympian
item.description: Montell Douglas will become the first female British athlete to compete at both the summer and winter Olympic Games after being named in the Team GB bobsleigh squad for Beijing.

item.title: Australian Open: Andy Murray opponent Taro Daniel almost hits umpire with wild return
item.description: Watch as Andy Murray's opponent Taro Daniel hits a wild return that skims the back of the chair umpire during their second round match at the Australian Open.

item.title: NBA: Watch Joel Embiid's best plays for Philadelphia 76ers
item.description: Watch Joel Embiid's best plays as he matches his career-high score of 50 points in the Philadelphia 76ers' 123-110 victory over the Orlando Magic.

item.title: Amir Khan: I don't think Kell Brook can take a shot
item.description: Amir Khan believes Kell Brook's punching power has gone and he can no longer take a shot as the animosity between the pair continues before they meet on 19 February in Manchester.

item.title: What are the latest Covid rules across the UK?
item.description: England is scrapping its "Plan B" Covid restrictions as Scotland and Wales also ease rules.

item.title: What are the latest rules for face coverings and masks?
item.description: People in England will soon no longer be legally required to wear facemasks.

item.title: What are the Covid self-isolation rules and will they be scrapped?
item.description: People with Covid in England may soon no longer have to self-isolate after testing positive.

item.title: Should I be working from home now?
item.description: The advice to work from home has been removed in England but will remain across the rest of the UK.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid passports: Where do I need a pass and how do I get one?
item.description: Mandatory Covid passports will be scrapped in England but remain across the rest of the UK.

item.title: What are the Covid rules in schools and will they stay open this term?
item.description: Schools have reopened across the UK with a variety of Covid restrictions in place.

item.title: Covid: How to look after yourself at home
item.description: What can you expect if you have Covid, and when should you get extra help?

item.title: When can I have a booster jab and how do I book one?
item.description: Some companies are cutting sick pay for unvaccinated staff who have to isolate after exposure to Covid.

item.title: Omicron symptoms: Is a runny nose a cold or Covid?
item.description: Could a runny nose be a sign you have Omicron?

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: Significant numbers of people have had long-term problems after recovering from coronavirus.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: How do I get a lateral flow test or a PCR?
item.description: Across the UK, people without symptoms no longer have to confirm a positive LFT result with a PCR.

item.title: What Covid tests do I need to travel abroad?
item.description: France is softening its entry requirements for vaccinated travellers from the UK.

item.title: Covid rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Omicron: How do I know if I have it?
item.description: The symptoms are similar to a cold, while genetic analysis is the only way to confirm the variant.

item.title: Coronavirus treatments: What progress is being made?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules?
item.description: Scotland and Wales are relaxing some of their restrictions around gatherings and mixing with others.

item.title: Specialist mental health unit failures exposed by patients
item.description: Patients say theyâve been placed in unsafe environments, often far from home.

item.title: Secret audio sheds light on toppled dictatorâs frantic last hours
item.description: The BBC has obtained extraordinary recordings believed to be of phone calls made by Tunisian ex president Zine al-Abidine Ben Ali as he flew out of the country in 2011.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine crisis: Why Brussels fears Europe is 'closest to war' in decades
item.description: Fears are rising over Russia's plans to shake up the region, writes BBC Europe editor Katya Adler.

item.title: Lea Campos: The Brazilian who battled prejudice & patriarchy to become a referee
item.description: Lea Campos battled opponents in the Brazilian establishment to achieve her dream and blaze a trail for others to follow.
